intro: Linaria tristis var. brevicalcarata, commonly known as the short-spurred toadflax, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers with two prominent upper lips and two lower lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a desirable plant for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
